page.title: 15ASHLEY VILLAGE:OPINIONS.
page.content: Ashley village is a{pleasant place but many problems threaten any{peace and{stability.}The 38 children in the school, of whom only seven live in the village, have two teachers. Closure is always{threatened}as facilities are somewhat limited and children find it hard to get to school in winter as there are no buses. Loss of such an active institution will{harm}the area. Some of the men in the garage have been there for over twnty five years and although they are very busy only farms offer alternative employment. When the sole policeman, a sergeant, retires he may not be replaced even though he knows most of the residents. His main problems are burglary, stray dogs, accidents and poaching. This village seems to be threatened by many things but at least its{rail link}to Altrincham and Knutsford is an asset.
